page.title: 14St. JOHN'S RC COMP. SCH.
page.content: The school draws its pupils from the parishes of Ferryhill, Crook, Shildon, Willington, Tow Law, Aycliffe, Bishop Auckland and Spennymoor and nearby villages. In the area of the survey both St. Chad's, Witton Park and St. Wilfred's send their juniors on to St. John's at 11. The school became comprehensive in the 1970s. Falling rolls have prompted discussions about its future and that of Carmel RC Comprehensive School at Darlington. Most of the pupils travel by contract bus to school and a typical scene at the end of the school day is the sight of the convoy of special buses pulling out of the car park. The school has about 800 pupils and about 48 staff and caters for 11 to 18 year olds including a sixth form. The school day is from 9am until 3.35pm.
